content:
What are everyone's thoughts on read-receipts feature naming? I have been mostly using read_indicators in the code but read_receipts is what's used everywhere else and probably makes more sense?
let me try polls :smile:
(adding polls doesn't seem to be working on editing messages)
I feel like "read receipts" is how I've usually this class of feature mentioned in documentation for other tools.

Tim Abbott said:

I feel like "read receipts" is how I've usually this class of feature mentioned in documentation for other tools.

Yes, that sounds more natural. I was inclined to use indicators having worked on typing indicators. I guess it doesn't make much sense in read receipts context.

I think there is a difference:

  • “read indicator”: I’ve read this message.
  • “read receipt”: I know that you’ve read this message.

Hmm, thanks for making the difference clear, Anders Kaseorg! So, we'd use the term (read) indicator when we have code marking as or sending read data? (to be clear, we don't have to do any mark as read operations here, asking just to make sure what I understood is right :)

Yeah, read receipts seems to make more sense. Will change to read_receipts in the [PR.] (https://github.com/zulip/zulip/pull/18935)
We already have unread “markers” and we don’t need to rename them—I’m just saying “indicators” is close enough to be interpreted as a synonym of that.
